video.title: Microsoft Excel Tutorial for Beginners - Full Course
video.description:
Lean how to use Microsoft Excel from the beginning by creating 6 real-world projects. Most of the content applies to Google Sheets as well.

You will learn how to
- enter data,
- navigate through a spreadsheet,
- create formulas to solve problems,
- create charts and graphs,
- understand relative vs absolute references,
- import and export data,
- implement VLOOKUP,
- use pivot tables,
- split and concatenate text, 
- and more.

✏️ Course developed by Shad Sluiter. Check out his YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/user/shadsluiter

⭐️ Course Contents ⭐️
⌨️ (0:00:00) Intro
⌨️ (0:04:14) Payroll
⌨️ (0:39:35) Gradebook
⌨️ (0:57:22) Decision Factors
⌨️ (1:04:40) Sales Database
⌨️ (1:23:13) Car Inventory
⌨️ (1:59:29) Problem Solving Templates

⭐️ Special thanks to our Champion supporters! ⭐️ 
🏆 Loc Do
🏆 Joseph C
🏆 DeezMaster

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://freecodecamp.org/news

topLevelComment.author: Juan Maldonado
topLevelComment.text: I separated OT from Regular pay rate total, I created a column next to the PAY column, and named it PAY without OT, I did (Pay - payrate * OT) now we have pay without the OT hours included. Then on the overtime column I did (1.5 * OT hours) and got my OT total, notice 1.5 is Time and a half. You can hide the column with the initial total hours equation to avoid confusion, If im doing overkill here please share a much shorter formula. Hope this helps!!

topLevelComment.author: Vedant Karale
topLevelComment.text:
This content is so amazing! Not just for beginners but also works as a quick refresher for people who've worked on excel previously. There's just one thing that I'd like to add which is not related to Excel or programming or analysis but might prove helpful and save some time.

♦Press Ctrl+<Arrow key> to navigate through rows and columns in excel.
♦Use this in combination with the Shift key and the mouse movement could reduced!

Although this speed-up is very subjectively perceived yet being a programmer, I like using the keyboard more than the mouse. Hope this helps 😄

topLevelComment.author: DualConcept
topLevelComment.text:
If I am not wrong the way of calculating total pay  is wrong . The formula for counting overtime pay is : A more detailed example: 

An employee works 50 hours in a week.
Her normal pay rate is $15 an hour.
So she is paid $600 for her 40 hours at $15 an hour, plus $225 for her additional 10 hours of overtime (at $15 x 1.5 x 10 = $225).
Her total pay for the week would be $825. 

 From your calculation say for Jon, He will get $15.90*40 = 636 plus overtime.  But you calculated $15.90*41=$651.90 plus overtime

topLevelComment.author: Kiev
topLevelComment.text: on absolute cell, what's the diff between putting $ on "$C4" and "C$4" ?

replies.author: EasyExcel
replies.text:
Hi Kiev. The dollar sign before the number or letter locks the column or row. $C4 means that it will always look at column C but row could change. I can do a video about it on my new channel if you need it

https://youtu.be/eXZysZRPKeQ

topLevelComment.author: Caveman Hood
topLevelComment.text:
(Also glad I was not the first to notice this. By your overtime calculation, a person that gets paid $15.00 an hour, but gets paid half their normal pay for overtime ($7.50)... There would be no overtime for me there. I will not work overtime for less then what I make an hour period, I think all would agree. )- Mistake comment......... explanation below...... 

When I am wrong I Amit it.

 I do believe I was wrong and I miss spoke. You total the hours of pay and then you added ( the half of pay to it Times the total number of Overtime hours )..... Too me the way you explained it was confusing since I do not calculate it that way..... it took me a few times of watching the video to find out I was wrong.

Sidenote
By watching your video I understand if statement now for the most part and wrote one. That does just that calculates up to 40 hours and returns 0 or - if no hours of overtimes is there.   ( less confusing for me that way ).

I do believe, correct me if I am wrong... overtime pay is Time and 1/2 .............

(Time) = Your rate of pay and hour              
(and) =                        +
(1/2) =    Half your rate of pay hour

      This really applies to lets say " Holiday pay" which when you work on a holiday... which also equals to Time and 1/2 like overtime pay. If you are one of the lucky ones that gets the day off but get paid for it then it is just your " Regular rate of pay an hour "

See examples below....... ( at lease this is how I do the calculation )

Lets say a person make $15.00 a hour ( 40 hours work week is assumed ) and 4 hours overtime

15.00/2= $7.50   1/2 your rate of pay
15.00+7.50= $22.50  Overtime payment and hour

15.00*40= $600.00   Regular Rate of pay total
22.50*4= $90.00  Overtime Rate of pay total

600+90= $690.00  Total of Reg and Overtime together

side note
Double time is your pay doubled, so if you get $15.00 hour, your pay would be $30.00 an hour.

topLevelComment.author: iMiruku
topLevelComment.text:
1) I wanted to say this is a really good darn video. Easy to follow, you can pause it whenever you want to mimic what's on the screen so that you fully understand, and then once you do; you can pause the rest of the video during the sections of inputting more data, then creating the formulas; repetition is key and once you've got that groove, you don't have to watch parts of the video, you can get it done before he does, and then watch him do it afterwards before moving on.

2) During this video, I know it's targeted towards Microsoft's Excel Spreadsheets, but during the beginning and end of this video and going forward in life with my Spreadsheet education, I've been using WPS Suite, which is only $40 for a whole year. The formulas, navigation of the buttons, formatting, etc; are all quite identical to Microsoft Excel, in WPS Suite, just an FYI. I've been able to follow the video so far 100% using WPS Suite and they're using Microsoft Excel.

topLevelComment.author: John Borron
topLevelComment.text: What I like about this is that you are providing multiple instruction at once. I've been learning excel in a sort of linear way (one topic/feature at a time), and this video has used a whole range of useful things (formatting, functions, column manipulation, cell tricks etc) at the same time, which is such a better way to learn this program. Only half an hour in but had to comment because I've learned so much from this video in that half hour. Maybe my prior learning helped.I've had to rewind it a couple of times just to make some things sink in, but this is definitely the most effective learning method I've used so far. This is excellent instruction, Professor Sluiter!

replies.author: chris falkenberg
replies.text:
Color of Money                                           State of Address                                       made in USA
   Going around in circles ( circuits ), chasing after one another for the color of money, taking chances or welfare through inter-connecting passages , crossroads and Windows (MSN)  trying to control the animal in one, from the pit  of debt of desire, an emotions in the matrix.   $
                                                                       Dollar    Dollar   Bills  
 Pressing the economics further, less than rich is most in debt, an the back bone of the rich, and the flesh and blood for the animal,   All in the name of what, property values.   The color of money makes people go wild (mad)  an adds to its fire.   Let me give it to you in other terms, terms you can understand.  They cut it like Bolvin coca, Afghani opium and Libyan oil, cut like silver and gold. Lords that have strings tied to the money, an every dollar in its web, hooking the foolish fish in the sea into its financial threshold.
    Bending indexes, the color of money, dollars, dollar bills and currencies on a spectrum in a temple dimension, attracting interest .  A twenty/eighty cut is knot well/fare, it cuts like a knife, a double edge sword, it gives with one and takes with two, we want face value, the whole in one, par ,  one over one, knot promises or the color of money, that s blinding you.
                                                      " O say can you see,"  ...   the twilight...                 
 Blind and color blind?  So cover your eyes, and listen," and  listen to your sub conscious maybe you'll learn something" . Its a figment of your imagination that's running wild like a bull, a shift to red , so let me give you the 20/20, the whole 9/1/1 doppler tax free fix, in the city  that never sleeps.   Its supply and demand.  They build it up and take them down , and the penny is losing one for everyone made.  The nickel cant hold its weight , but its losing, an its face value is deceiving  the public eye, so save what you can .  
  They cant afford it or  don't have it to give away, nor can they make  anymore,   Its coming from the blood that is spilling from the holes in ones pocket and clothing, and the bodies that are falling.  Desire is working ten times harder for ten times less and buying things ten times over   exhausting its horns and pleasures.  At the end of the sale,  and day , after all the hands have taken a pinch out of the dollar , dollar bill,  one is paying  with the bottom dollar, and by the time it gets home to its family, its taxed for the waste, so save what you can.  
   Either way I, the self, put it , between the differences , it gives one the sum of the hole, the color of money  and  the same sum and truth ,the wholesumtruth.   Now that the money can be made at home , it does not give one the right to cut it out of a  sheet of metal and stamp it with a dye,  or (DIO ?),  " O, Alice, your the Greatest ", its de-facing the value . " Its not what your  country can do for you , but what you can do for your country."    " We the people", put our trust in the government, ( each other), to provide honest scales and due process, but those who aren't themselves are favoring one side, one side of the scale, the dark side, even though the wind is not for sale, it gives one direction and shows the way , an only a fool doesn't pay attention to signs, lining its pockets , the holes in its clothing with the blood on its hands.  Those who live by it , live by the dollar , dollar bill , fall by it, and those who trust in it, give its power and right  over their lives, ( soul) .  " O, say can you see"
    The only one who cares for a title, is lost and needs to be found, an  in need of a personality,  the individual, and  needed to be  served with love and sincerity.      The servant , common worker, the confidence and capital  from whom has a title  paid for, is free of, and develops its independence from a co-dependent sovereign and shadow government.      " O say, can you see"...  the twilight...
  They promise them heaven, a spot in the light an all they can eat,  and give them hell for it,  leaving them to the wicked , emotional trials and shadows , silhouettes that have no eyes , but still can see.  So ,"  Take down these walls".                                " Four score and seven"
  We were given stripes , color and life , light for a conscious , a lamp of knowledge (law) , a guiding light, and land to harvest.   The brave to boycott, pro/test, protest in writing;  Declare Independence,   and reveal the truth and reap whats sowed.  Fear not, " fear only fear it-self ",  "we are not left to live under ourselves " , we have been brought to consciousness , life, and Yahweh ( Jah e vah ) (יהוה )  .       Compose yourselves, bring yourselves together,  because   no matter how much one celebrates it will not raise the dead, nor bring back those who have passed, and neither free one from the misery and trial its been living.  
" O , say can you see....................."                    "  The fault is not in the stars , but in ourselves."

topLevelComment.author: Cornelious Stradivarius
topLevelComment.text:
Just did task no.1 with just a couple of error icons in 1 or 2 of the cells but clicked "Ignore" and all looks fine.
I have to say I hate this stuff but I'm looking for seated work because the arthritis in my knees wont allow me to do physical work anymore.
That being said I have to commend you Mr.Sluiter. The way you show us both in clear visuals as well as the pace and tone of your voice eased me into this removing any anxiety I had learning this.

I'm going to practice this a lot today before I move onto the next part of the Payroll tutorial so it's embedded in my head without thinking.

THANK YOU! : ]

(Revelation 21:8) Have you ever stolen anything (value is irrelevant and includes downloading or copying movies illegally)?  If you’ve lusted, you’ve committed adultery in your heart. topLevelComment.author: Zachary Schreiber
topLevelComment.text: While I appreciate the attempt to utilize Excel for real world problems, I'm disappointed by the lack of completeness in your School Shopping Supplies problem. As Susan has three possible stories to shop from, I fully expected you to first determine which store would provide her the best price for each item before calculating total cost. Why would she need three lists of costs and three totals? Is she only planning to go to one store? Or is she going to go to all 3 stores and only buy the items at their lowest cost? And, will she be picking up items for Tim as well? If she is, why isn't she combining the two lists of item quantities needed before figuring costs? If Tim isn't going shopping, why do we need his total at all? Why not make this a real real world experience? Also, I'm surprised that you didn't use $F3 to figure the item cost for each store so that you didn't have to write a new formula in H3 and I3.

Somebody needs to hear this: 
Matt 21:37 But as the days of Noah were, so shall also the coming of the Son of man be. 38 For as in the days that were before the flood they were eating and drinking, marrying and giving in marriage, until the day that Noe entered into the ark, 39 And knew not until the flood came, and took them all away; so shall also the coming of the Son of man be.
8 people were saved...

THE MILLION-DOLLAR QUESTION: Will you go to Heaven when you die? Have you lied, stolen, used God’s name in vain, or lusted (which Jesus said was adultery, (Matthew 5:28)? If so, God sees you as a liar, thief, blasphemer, and adulterer at heart. If you die in your sins, you will end up in a terrible place called Hell. But there's good news. Though we broke God's Law, Jesus paid the fine by dying on the cross: "God so loved the world that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him should not perish but have everlasting life" (John. 3:16). Then Jesus rose from the dead and was seen by hundreds of eyewitnesses. He fulfilled all the prophecies of the promised Savior. Please, today, repent and trust Jesus, and God will forgive you and grant you the gift of eternal life (Ephesians. 2:8-9). 

The ABC's of salvation by JDFarag.org ❤

A-Admit that you are a sinner in need of a savior. 
📖Romans 3:10 KJV 10 As it is written, There is none righteous, no, not one:
📖Romans 3:23 KJV 23 For all have sinned, and come short of the glory of God;

B- Believe that Jesus is Lord , died for your sins and rose from the dead. 
📖Romans 5:8 KJV 8 But God commendeth his love toward us, in that, while we were yet sinners, Christ died for us.
📖Romans 6:23 KJV 23 For the wages of sin is death; but the gift of God is eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord.

C- Call upon his name. 
📖Romans 10:9 KJV 9 That if thou shalt confess with thy mouth the Lord Jesus, and shalt believe in thine heart that God hath raised him from the dead, thou shalt be saved.
📖Romans 10:13 KJV 13 For whosoever shall call upon the name of the Lord shall be saved

topLevelComment.author: Brady Simmons
topLevelComment.text:
I need help. I have learned a lot about excel in the past couple of years, but I am mostly a novice as I do not build new spreadsheets often. I use a spreadsheet that I mostly built for work, where I input data along with a date that the data was input on. I have coded the formulas needed to give me a collective set of info we use each job site. 
   However, we also use the date info to guesstimate job site finish date and time as we go. To do this, we literally count the amount of data input by day and average it by hand. 
   I want to make a separate tab attached to this spreadsheet that automatically creates either a graph, or a table that will input the date by itself and *count* the number of dates that are put into the sheet on the main tab.
  For example, if the job I'm on lasts 3 weeks and I input data on 12/2/21 14 times, and 12/3/21 13 times, etc the other tab should "build" a list table-style, or a graph that simply shows the number of entries by date and also averages it. I can do the average part, and I have read about getting into from another tab, and even how to reference the other tab by using the '!' function but collectively I cannot figure it all out. And I also have 6 different ranges on the main tab I input dates. 
  Help!

topLevelComment.author: Blessed American
topLevelComment.text:
I guess I am old school because you are the only person I can clearly follow. 
It’s amazing how many teachers talk like a rapid fire weapon so that the student doesn’t have time to process the information.
My explanation is that a teacher should speak at a rate that a fast writer could copy everything they say.
They could also listen to David Attenborough who frequently pauses for a few seconds.
Kallistos Ware who is the head of the Greek Orthodox Church and a 30 year professor at Oxford speaks slowly. He also enunciates clearly.
One guy on Coursera talks so fast and keeps saying, “ I could do this or that but I’m not” which totally confuses the student. He even clicks and shows what he is not going to do.
I digress, but thank you for a well taught class.

Thank you very much for helping me to practice & master Excel again. I almost forgot everything, as I learnt it 8 years ago & never got to use it again.

I guess I wasn't clear in my question.
If I followed correctly, cell c4 ($20) * cell d4 (41hrs).
But ot hrs are cell i4 (1) (=if(d4>40,d4-40,0))
N4 ($820) ((=$c4*$d4))
X4 ($830) ((=n4+s4)) that's how I understood your instructions. 
However, =Product (c4,40)+ Product(i4,s4) returns $810. Somewhere there's an error.  I don't see it in my formula because =20*40=800 +1*10=10 so 800+10=810.
Now can someone reply so we all grow. 
If I as an employer find you're paying workers incorrectly, I will deal with you not excuse you behind a formula you learned online. Make sense?
S4 ($10) ((=0.5*$c4*$i4))

   Going around in circles ( circuits ), chasing after one another for the color of money, taking chances or welfare through inter-connecting passages , crossroads and Windows (MSN)  trying to control the animal in one, from the pit  of debt of desire, an emotions in the matrix.   $
                                                                       Dollar    Dollar   Bills  
 Pressing the economics further, less than rich is most in debt, an the back bone of the rich, and the flesh and blood for the animal,   All in the name of what, property values.   The color of money makes people go wild (mad)  an adds to its fire.   Let me give it to you in other terms, terms you can understand.  They cut it like Bolvin coca, Afghani opium and Libyan oil, cut like silver and gold. Lords that have strings tied to the money, an every dollar in its web, hooking the foolish fish in the sea into its financial threshold.
    Bending indexes, the color of money, dollars, dollar bills and currencies on a spectrum in a temple dimension, attracting interest .  A twenty/eighty cut is knot well/fare, it cuts like a knife, a double edge sword, it gives with one and takes with two, we want face value, the whole in one, par ,  one over one, knot promises or the color of money, that s blinding you.
                                                      " O say can you see,"  ...   the twilight...                 
 Blind and color blind?  So cover your eyes, and listen," and  listen to your sub conscious maybe you'll learn something" . Its a figment of your imagination that's running wild like a bull, a shift to red , so let me give you the 20/20, the whole 9/1/1 doppler tax free fix, in the city  that never sleeps.   Its supply and demand.  They build it up and take them down , and the penny is losing one for everyone made.  The nickel cant hold its weight , but its losing, an its face value is deceiving  the public eye, so save what you can .  
  They cant afford it or  don't have it to give away, nor can they make  anymore,   Its coming from the blood that is spilling from the holes in ones pocket and clothing, and the bodies that are falling.  Desire is working ten times harder for ten times less and buying things ten times over   exhausting its horns and pleasures.  At the end of the sale,  and day , after all the hands have taken a pinch out of the dollar , dollar bill,  one is paying  with the bottom dollar, and by the time it gets home to its family, its taxed for the waste, so save what you can.  
   Either way I, the self, put it , between the differences , it gives one the sum of the hole, the color of money  and  the same sum and truth ,the wholesumtruth.   Now that the money can be made at home , it does not give one the right to cut it out of a  sheet of metal and stamp it with a dye,  or (DIO ?),  " O, Alice, your the Greatest ", its de-facing the value . " Its not what your  country can do for you , but what you can do for your country."    " We the people", put our trust in the government, ( each other), to provide honest scales and due process, but those who aren't themselves are favoring one side, one side of the scale, the dark side, even though the wind is not for sale, it gives one direction and shows the way , an only a fool doesn't pay attention to signs, lining its pockets , the holes in its clothing with the blood on its hands.  Those who live by it , live by the dollar , dollar bill , fall by it, and those who trust in it, give its power and right  over their lives, ( soul) .  " O, say can you see"
    The only one who cares for a title, is lost and needs to be found, an  in need of a personality,  the individual, and  needed to be  served with love and sincerity.      The servant , common worker, the confidence and capital  from whom has a title  paid for, is free of, and develops its independence from a co-dependent sovereign and shadow government.      " O say, can you see"...  the twilight...
  They promise them heaven, a spot in the light an all they can eat,  and give them hell for it,  leaving them to the wicked , emotional trials and shadows , silhouettes that have no eyes , but still can see.  So ,"  Take down these walls".                                " Four score and seven"
  We were given stripes , color and life , light for a conscious , a lamp of knowledge (law) , a guiding light, and land to harvest.   The brave to boycott, pro/test, protest in writing;  Declare Independence,   and reveal the truth and reap whats sowed.  Fear not, " fear only fear it-self ",  "we are not left to live under ourselves " , we have been brought to consciousness , life, and Yahweh ( Jah e vah ) (יהוה )  .       Compose yourselves, bring yourselves together,  because   no matter how much one celebrates it will not raise the dead, nor bring back those who have passed, and neither free one from the misery and trial its been living.  
" O , say can you see............."                    "  The fault is not in the stars , but in ourselves."

topLevelComment.author: Grus Wang
topLevelComment.text: Hello Shad, in terms of the 4th part of the problem solving, which is "clear up the printer confusion", I don’t agree with your preset spreadsheet on the second part which uses the cost per page to calculate the total print cost. Because as a costumer, you have to buy a whole set of cartridge even though you cannot use its whole capacity. For example, for Susan, to calculate the print cost if using Zero, you should at least buy 1 Zero Toner set (which capacity is 11,000 pages) for Susan 2 years’ print (7,800 pages =2*52*5*15), which cost $370 instead of $262.36 (=370/11,000*7,800). hope get your reply.

replies.text: Hi there. I had the same issue, so I went to his site and opened a raw file, held the text down, clicked copy all and saved it to microsoft word. Then I opened Microsoft word and saved as .txt. When I opened txt on excel, it opened wrongly in the tables when I clicked delimited, so I went back to word, made adjustment to the commas to put it back to original form when compared to the raw file( as in each car ID on a seperate line, because placement of commas is the number of columns in excel) then I saved as txt and imported to excel and then only it opened correctly.

topLevelComment.author: Paras Srivastava
topLevelComment.text:
Excel is one of the most used tools in business, engineering, accountancy and many more industries. It helps you organise and manipulate a large amount of data which can be otherwise time-consuming, mundane and difficult to organise. Excel has proven to be a skill that increases your chances of securing a job. It can help you accelerate your career in many different directions such as you can start your journey as a data analyst. If you are in the business sector, it becomes a necessity to learn excel. It helps you manage inventory, human resources and finances.

Thanks a lot for sharing such valuable content 😊
